intro: Sphaeralcea fendleri f. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its globular shape, with clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are usually lobed and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in well-drained soils. This variety is distinguished by its pale flowers, which contrast with the more commonly found pink or red-flowered forms of the species.
